DataElement.preferredName: First Greater Than or Equal To Neutrophil Count 500 Recovery Occurrence Absolute Neutrophil Count Laboratory Finding
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The outcome of the laboratory procedure related to the assessment of the first greater than or equal 500 absolute neutrophil count recovery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: First Greater Than or Equal To Neutrophil Count 500 Recovery Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._.Indicates a neutrophil count of at least 500 per cubic millimeter._A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: First Greater Than or Equal To Neutrophil Count 500 Recovery
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:Indicates a neutrophil count of at least 500 per cubic millimeter.:gradual healing (through rest) after sickness or injury.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
Indicates a neutrophil count of at least 500 per cubic millimeter.
A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The real number of white blood cells (WBC) that are neutrophils. It is derived by multiplying the WBC count by the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count. The normal range for ANC is 1.5 to 8.0 (1,500 to 8,000/mm3)._The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition.

PermissibleValues.value: Not applicable - ANC never dropped below 500/mmE3 at any time after the start of the preparative regimen

PermissibleValues.value: Yes - ANC >= 500/mmE3 achieved and sustained for 3 lab values
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Yes - ANC >= 500/mmE3 achieved and sustained for 3 lab values

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Yes - ANC >= 500/mmE3 achieved and sustained for 3 lab values
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Yes - ANC >= 500/mmE3 achieved and sustained for 3 lab values

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The real number of white blood cells (WBCs) that are neutrophils. The ANC is derived by multiplying the WBC count times the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count; the percent of neutrophils consists of the segmented (fully mature neutrophils) + the bands (almost mature neutrophils). The normal range for the ANC is 1.5 to 8.0 (1,500 to 8,000/mm3).:The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition.

Concepts.definition: The real number of white blood cells (WBC) that are neutrophils. It is derived by multiplying the WBC count by the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count. The normal range for ANC is 1.5 to 8.0 (1,500 to 8,000/mm3).
The result of a lab test to measure an attribute or to determine the presence, absence or degree of a condition.
